{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infant presents with respiratory distress shortly after birth and requires mechanical ventilation. The chest radiograph shows a diffuse ground glass appearance to the lung fields. Surfactant replacement fails to improve gas exchange. The negative culture and echocardiographic findings rule out infection and cardiac anomalies. The history of a term female sibling who died with respiratory distress suggests a genetic cause. The most likely diagnosis in this case is neonatal pulmonary alveolar proteinosis, which is a rare genetic disorder characterized by abnormal accumulation of surfactant in the alveoli.", "answer_choice": "A"}
